resources.string: Enables JavaScript using .enableJavaScript(true). If this is false you\'ll still be able to invoke JavaScript via remote debugging.
Enables remote WebView debugging. Connect from Chrome\'s Developer tools via ADB.
Allows access to the file:// resources.
Allows file:// resources to access other files.
Allows file:// resources to access resources on the Internet

Adds a JavaScript interface to the WebView via the method addJavaScriptInterface(). The interface is accessible via JavaScript using the object "javascriptBridge". Changing this setting will reload the current page.
Add a WebViewClient to the WebView so that links are opened inside the WebView and not with an external browser.
The WebView exposes native methods.\nCan you steal the secret in a man-in-the middle attack by injecting JavaScript code?
The application can already access the external storage

Website: https://www.authenticationfailure.com/wmb/

GitHub: https://github.com/authenticationfailure/WheresMyBrowser.Android

Twitter: @endle__

Load data directly into the WebView with \'loadData\' or \'loadDataWithBaseURL\'. If \'loadData\' is used, the scheme is set to \'data:\'
Base URL. If empty BaseURL is set to \"null\"
A newer version of the application is available. Download it from\
